title: The 2 engine driven pumps (EDP) supply the main hydraulic sy…
caption_en: The 2 engine driven pumps (EDP) supply the main hydraulic system.

title: For training purposes, the main hydraulic system flow is ill…
caption_en: For training purposes, the main hydraulic system flow is illustrated in green. If the engines are not running, the 2 EDP symbols are amber. Once the engines are started and when the hydraulic pressure is above psi, they will turn cyan.

title: Normal system pressure is psi. The main system pressure surg…
caption_en: Normal system pressure is psi. The main system pressure surges produced by the 2 EDPs are absorbed by the surge accumulator to prevent damage to the hydraulic components.

title: The main system pressurises the thrust reversers, spoilers a…
caption_en: The main system pressurises the thrust reversers, spoilers and spoilerons. The landing gears and flaps are normally pressurised by the main system. If the main system pressure is low, the gear and flap systems can be pressurised by the auxiliary system via the hydraulic cross-flow valve.

title: The normal brake system is also pressurised by the main syst…
caption_en: The normal brake system is also pressurised by the main system via a shuttle valve. This shuttle valve allows the auxiliary system to pressurise the brakes if the main system pressure is low. Normal braking is referred to as braking using the brake pedals.
